Regards,
Mulan Mojo Academy
events.location: Singapore, 1 minute to Marymount MRT, Singapore null

events.name: Neuross Demo Day
events.description:
Ever wanted to use your brain to control things? Do you want to be the next Professor X?

Neuross is NTU Open Source Society's new ad-hoc initiative, created in collaboration with NeuroTechX, which will be focused on neurotechnology and its applications. This demo day is aimed at introducing this initiative and recruiting members to our growing core team.

The agenda is as follows:
- Introduction to Neuross
- Introduction to NeuroTechX & Hackers in Neurotechnology
- Talk on Brain-Computer Interface
- Overview of Various Neurotechnology Projects
- Demo of Starter Neurotechnology Projects
- How can you get involved?

Join us to learn more about neurotechnology, how you can get involved and what Neuross is all about!

events.name: Stubbed Automation - Learn > Apply > Watch-out
events.description:
Hello Folks, A very happy new year and warm welcome into 2017. 


We are back on our learning journey. This time with our friend Christopher Rex from ThoughtWorks with strong functional testing, test automation, defect prevention, continuous integration skills and agile expertise. 


As the title suggests we will learn about the concepts, how to's and pitfalls associated with using stubs for our tests. 


Agenda: 6.30 - 7.00 PM - Snacks & Networking 7.00 - 8.00 PM - Stubbed Automation - Talk & Demo 8.00 - 8.30 PM - Discussion, Q&A 8.30 onwards - Finish remaining snacks

events.name: Experience from Data Science Competitions (Kaggle and DrivenData)
events.description:
For our meetup in February, Quy and Yi Xiang will be sharing about their experience in data science competitions on DrivenData and Kaggle respectively. Quy competed in the DrivenData Safe Aging Challenge, where competitors were charged with building computer algorithms that could translate the easier-to-collect sensor data into harder-to-collect information about real activities (https://www.drivendata.org/competitions/42/). Yi Xiang competed in the Kaggle Allstate Claims Severity Challenge, where competitors were challenged to create an algorithm which accurately predicts claims severity (https://www.kaggle.com/c/allstate-claims-severity). 


Please note of our new attendance policy. Attendees are REQUIRED to RSVP to the event to be allowed into the venue. People who are neither in the "going" nor "wait" lists will be turned away. Registration is necessary due to the security clearance to access the location.  RSVPs will open on 7th February 12pm and close on 14th Feb 6.30pm.  Event details: • 7.00 - 7.30pm: Networking [casual; small talk] • 7.30 - 8.00pm: DrivenData Safe Aging Challenge [core] • 8.00 - 8.30pm: Kaggle Allstate Claims Severity [hardcore] [] : Suggested rating and topic; ranges from: newbie - casual - core - hardcore.  Speakers Quy • Kaggle Master. Curious, serious. Strong data scientist. • Highlight skills: team player, data driven, well-organized, advanced user of Java/Spark/Hadoop, Python (sklearn, pandas..), familiar with R, Tensorflow, Caffe for deep learning. • Main research interests are machine learning, artificial intelligent. • Specialties: Tune algorithms, data mining, analysis  Yi Xiang  Currently a Junior Data Scientist with Merck - known as MSD outside of USA and Canada. He considers himself 35% Mathematician, 35% Statistician, 20% Computer scientist and 10% business. His passion lies in Applied Mathematics, Algorithm Design, Data Analytics, Statistics, Machine Learning. In his free time now, he spends at least half a day weekly to upgrade himself with new tools, this keeps him updated with technology as it is rapidly changing and we have to constantly challenge our knowledge!
events.location: IMDA PIXEL Labs@NDC,  111 Middle Road #03-04, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969

events.name: Monthly Meet - Attacker perspective on Active Directory and DevOps Security
events.description:
Agenda • High Tea and Networking • Introduction & Announcement • Attacker’s Perspective of Active Directory by Sunny Neo. • Security in DevOps pipeline by Mohammed A. Imran (each talk is of 45 mins. including QnA) Abstract:  1. Attacker’s Perspective of Active Directory This talk is a compilation of Red Team’s Tactics, Techniques and Procedures to fully compromise an Active Directory environment. The emphasis will be on post-exploitation techniques that attackers/red teamers have been abusing for years, however they were not well documented until recent years. Apart from offensive techniques, mitigation and detection methods will be covered as well. 2. Security in DevOps Pipeline.  This talk will walk through the benefits of having security as part of DevOps pipeline.  Bio(s) of Speakers: Sunny Neo is a Penetration Tester with BT Security, Ethical Hacking Centre of Excellence, a global team that performs security testing for various industries. Besides his day job, he teaches Ethical Hacking at Temasek Polytechnic as an Adjunct Lecturer, and is one of the CREST Assessors in Singapore. He is certified with CCT APP, OSCE, OSCP and GXPN. He has 1 year plus of working experience. 


Mohammed A Imran ( @secfigo )  is senior software security engineer at Autodesk and specializes in vulnerability assessment, penetration testing and static code analysis. He loves to build infosec communities, share his knowledge with the community  and has organized around 60+ security events for the best null chapter, null hyderabad in India. He now leads null Singapore chapter. When not at work, he likes to practice his design skills and fiddle with development frameworks.
events.location: Zendesk Singapore, 401 Commonwealth Drive Haw Par Technocentre, #07-01
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - February 2017 Meetup
events.description: Dear All, Its meetup time again at Singapore SQL PASS Chapter.  Please refer below for the details. Agenda: February 15th - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Sarbjit Singh Gill 8:00 PM to 8:15 - Break 8:15 PM to 9:15 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Dharmendra Keshari Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22  BR-01 Topic 1:  Uncovering your true capability in the tech world Synopsis: Have you asked yourself the question why you do what you do ? Are you thinking about it or are you in an automatic mode, just doing without thinking? Speaker Profile: Sarbjit Singh Gill I bring 24 years of IT experience spanning consulting, architecture and training for Microsoft technologies such as Lync, Exchange, SQL Server, SharePoint, Windows Server, Active Directory, System Center range of products. I am also experienced in carrying out a Microsoft IO (Infrastructure Optimization) and Implementation of the MS MOF (Microsoft Operations Framework).Since 2005, I have been a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) with Technical Expertise in Lync, SCOM and SharePoint.I have participated as a speaker and proctor in numerous conference and forums and co-authored a book on MS Exchange monitoring using SCOM. As a MVP, I am founder of Singapore Lync User Group and an active member of other MS Technologies User Group communities. I hold a FIA International "C" racing license and I race actively in Japan and Malaysia in touring cars endurance and club races.I am an active Scuba Diver with interest in underwater videography. Topic 2:  DeadLock Troubleshooting Synopsis: In this session, we will learn about locking & blocking in SQL Server. Based on that knowledge you will learn about the various kinds of deadlocks that can occur in SQL Server, how to troubleshooting them. It will help you to decide your index strategy and database settings. Speaker Profile: Dharmendra Keshari Dharmendra Keshari has strong and in-depth experience in Database Management and its internals. Currently, working as Senior Database Administrator in one of the best Semi-Government organization in Singapore. He is an avid, regular mentor on social media, helping several enthusiast in solving problems related to Database management. He has completed certification for “Microsoft SQL Server® 2008, Implementation” and “Maintenance & Administering Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Database”
events.location: Microsoft Singapore - 22BR-01, 1 Marina Boulevard #22-01 One Marina Boulevard Singapore 018989

events.name: IGDA pres. Securing Your Future in the SG Game Dev Industry
events.description:
Hey all! 

Come join us as we speak about how being part of this community has helped industry professionals as well as how it can help you; Learn first-hand about how the industry works and how it affects you in securing a job. Empower yourself to strive in the industry with tips on networking, exchanging knowledge and giving each other support. You too can make a difference!

Speakers: 
Don Baey (IMDA): 
How IMDA can help (a word from our sponsor!)

Howard Sin (4EVA Studios)
Ian Gregory (IGDA & Witching Hour Studios)
Gwen Guo (IGDA & IMBA Interactive)

Game Industry 101
How to make a kickass portfolio
The awesomeness of community

For STUDENTS -- Get a feel of what the games industry is about as a career. Learn how to be ready for the industry before graduation. Discover resources and mentorship for your portfolio. Get insight from professionals on how community is important.

For PROFESSIONALS-- Be in contact with the future of the games industry, find new ways to sustain and provide value to the community

Location: PIXEL building Seminar Room (Level2)
Time: 7pm

Grab your own dinner first as food will not be provided :-( See you all there!
events.location: Pixel Building, 10 Central Exchange Green #03-01, Pixel Building Singapore 138649
